reviewText: This is a somewhat typical TV movie about a holiday romance. It's fairly low budget and does involve some cheesy acting and scenes here and there. However, in spite of a rocky start, this one ends up being pretty likable in the end. It is the story of a nice girl who works for an incredibly selfish, overbearing and abusive boss. At the beginning of the movie, she is dressed up in costume to go to a party. In a strange turn of events, she is in an elevator with a handsome rich guy. When the elevator malfunctions, they end up kissing without knowing who they are and then go their separate ways. It turns out the guy is her boss' finacee, but he doesn't end up recognizing her in her everyday attire. Over the course of the movie, she ends up being forced to work at his house because she and her boss have agree to decorate for the holidays. Inevitably, they bond and he remembers the kiss in the elevator without knowing the identity of the girl. Without spoiling the ending, suffice it to say that it is similar to many other movies like this. There are a few scenes here and there in the move that are a bit implausible and the girl's boss is so horrific, she is almost not believable. Other than that, it is a well-done low-budget film. There is a ton of chemistry between the main characters and you find yourself really hoping they end up together. If you watch this more as a loose retelling of the Cinderella tale rather than a realistic real-life story, it works. I would recommend this is you like clean feel-good Christmas stories.
summary: A lot of spark in the end

reviewText: I like good clean movies (or as clean as you can get nowadays). Christmas Kiss was fairly clean, except for swearing (not extreme, but noticeable), and some low cut/short shirts/dresses. I really enjoyed the movie and will definitely watch it again. Most people would skip it because they think it is too predictable or "lame", but I like movies like that because I know I will be watching something that won't make me feel like I have just been "slimed".Wendy is an aspiring designer, and an assistant to the most successful designer in Boston, Priscilla (who you hate throughout the entire show).  One night, Wendy gets into an elevator with a mysterious man, who kisses her when she gets thrown into his arm when they think the elevator is about to plummet (because of course that is what you think of when you think your going to die;)  Unfortunately, Wendy discovers the next day that the mysterious man is Priscilla's boyfriend, Adam, (and he doesn't recognize Wendy!!!).  Adam asks Pricilla to decorate his apartment for a Christmas party.  Wendy is inspired by Adam's love for a book his Grandmother bought him before she died,  and creates a design that reflects that theme.  Pricilla says they are absolutely horrible and it won't impress anyone; however, when Adam turns down Pricilla's own design, she claims Wendy's as her own and Adam loves them.  Pricilla leaves town after an accident where she was hit in the face.  Adam and Wendy's friendship grows since they are now thrown together to finish getting the house ready in time.  He starts to fall in love with her and rethinks proposing to Pricilla, but when Pricilla comes home and she is then forced to take drastic measures to make sure her engagement goes forward as planned.  She lies and schemes to get Adam to propose, fires Wendy and threatens her to not tell Adam, but thanks to Wendy's two friends, they do some scheming of their own to get Adam and Wendy back together.Overall, I loved the movie and will definitely watch it again.
summary: A Christmas Kiss - Will definately watch again
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've watched a lot of Christmas movies and romantic comedies with my wife. A Christmas Kiss is basically a mashup of the two genres. It's not badly done. The acting is fine, the production much better than the typical made-for-TV movie, and the plot isn't completely mindless. However, the movie is overflowing with cliches, almost to the point of suffocation. The plot was entirely predictable from scene 1. The protagonist is filled with holiday cheer while her boss is essentially a grinch. If you need something to watch while you cuddle with your significant other during the holidays, this movie will probably work, but I'm just tired of the utter lack of originality in these types of films.

reviewText: This is a great Christmastime movie, or for me, an anytime movie. I loved this one from beginning to end. The acting was right on and believable. The characters were rich and glistened like the decorations of the season. And speaking of decorations...this movie puts Laura Breckenridge's character to the task of decking-out the home of the man of her dreams for a Christmas Gala. Laura's character is that of just a regular girl, hardworking and a full of integrity. Her boss is the current girlfriend of the man of her dreams, and she is full of all kinds of stuff, none of which has integrity in the mix. Laura's character knows she is made to be with this man, but how is she going to pull everything off? I just love it when a good Christmastime plan comes together. The fun of watching it come together will spark the Christmas spirit in you, while the scenes of Christmas support the romantic storyline.

reviewText: A chance kiss on a scary elevator ride leaves Wendy's world shaken up. She had been all business lately--no time for fun. But her roommates could see that this kiss had brought a new spark to their friend. Wendy had left her job as a set designer for community theater to work for a star in the interior design world, hoping to advance her own career. But her boss, Miss Hall, is demanding, self centered, and unscrupulous. Wendy is called upon at all hours to fulfill Miss Hall's every whim. Now this mysterious man who kissed her as the elevator seemed to have doomed them to perish together, has breathed fresh life into her heart. Problem is, Wendy was rather disguised when the kiss took place, so he would not recognize her, and she has no idea who he is.One day his identity is revealed and Wendy must work closely with him while he has no idea who she is. Her roommates want her to tell him, but she can't bring herself to do it.Meanwhile, things with her boss are going from bad to worse. Wendy receives an ultimatum that could ruin her chances of ever being hired in her chosen field without leaving town.A fun plot where you are cheering on the "good guy" and booing the mean boss, much like a melodrama. The roommates are quirky, with good hearts, and the leading characters are well played.I enjoyed the story, but for me it was marred by the language--mostly what we refer to at our house as potty language. Unnecessary crude words that slipped occasionally from a character's mouth. It wasn't frequent, but it needn't have happened at all. On top of that, there was a tendency to profane the Lord's name. Sad to me, because all of that could have been omitted and this would have been a really fun chick flick with nothing to complain about.

reviewText: This movie A Christmas Kiss is starring Elisabeth Rohm, Laura Breckenridge and Brendan Fehr.  A Christmas Kiss is about a young woman named Wendy (Laura Breckenridge) who is an aspiring designer and assistant to her boss Priscilla (Elisabeth Rohm) who loves to make Wendy's life miserable.  One evening when Wendy is leaving work she meets a man named Adam (Brendan Fehr) in an elevator. The of them kiss. When Wendy arrives at the next morning Adam is there. Adam is Priscilla's long term boyfriend.  Priscilla and Wendy are planning a Christmas party at Adam's apartment. There are times Wendy and Adam have times alone.  Watch this movie to see if Adam ever remembers Wendy from the elevator. This a really cute movie!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this movie even though I am not a fan of the made for TV Xmas genre. But it's insane how much I love this movie!!! So much so, I bought a copy to watch year round. Yes, no true surprises because we all know how it will end. But the road there is so enjoyable. This kind of made for TV movie is a dime a dozen yet A Christmas Kiss has sparkle. The look of the movie is great from the costumes to the sets and the acting, for the most part, is very believable. I really dug the heroine's roommates. The three young ladies seemed so authentic as friends. And the gorgeous Elizabeth Rohm is so very Cruella DeVille here. She should do straight up comedy. Laura Breckenridge, adorable. What can I say? I felt a flutter. I felt a spark. And I'm enjoying seeing the friends in other works.

reviewText: I am a huge fan of romantic movies and christmas movies, so when the two are combined I'm in heaven.  The title of this movie captured my attention, and the DVD cover is stunning - when I read what it was about, I had high expectations.  It didn't disappoint.  The two leads Wendy and Adam, played by Laura Breckenridge and Brendan Fehr, are so charming, and I really believed them in their roles.  I felt the bond between them developing as they got to know each other, and I liked how they really listened to each other.  I genuinely believed in their love.  Of course no movie would be complete without a villian, and Elisabeth Rohm as Wendy's cruel, manipulative boss, who wanted Adam for herself, was perfect in her role.  She will be the character you love to hate. The whole movie was also visually stunning, and the music was so beautiful.  It's a shame there is no soundtrack for this movie.  If you love clean, romantic movies filled with warmth and charm, then I highly recommend this.  It will definitely be a favorite I will watch every christmas from now on.

reviewText: I enjoyed this movie. I purchased it because it was recommended when I bought a different movie. I am glad that I purchased it. It is a fun little romantic movie set around Christmas. It did not have any cussing in it or anything like that. There are no overly romantic scenes, so children could watch this movie. I enjoyed how the main male lead came to realize which of the woman was right for him. I don't want to give away the story but I enjoyed the antics of the friends to help the guy see who was the right woman for him. I really enjoyed how it ended. I thought it could have been a little longer, to give us more at the end but I still liked it. i would recommend this movie if asked for a good enjoyable Christmas movie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay, so I love Christmas movies, really, I do.  This one is a really sweet movie and I won't repeat the story line as it is already written for you.  I enjoyed Wendy's friends, they added some unexpected spice to this film.  If you are into Christmas chic flicks, this should be on your list.  And yes, it does have a predictable love story ending but worth watching anyway.
